OF THE

PUBLIC ACCOUNTS

FOR THE

FINANCIAL YEAR ENDING 30TH JUNE,

1890.

REGINA.

PRINTED BY R. B. GORDON, PRINTER TO THE GOVERNMENT OF THE NORTH-WEST TERRITORIES.

1890.
STATEMENT

OF THE

PUBLIC ACCOUNTS

OF THE

NORTH-WEST TERRITORIES,

FOR THE

FINANCIAL YEAR ENDED 30TH JUNE,

1890.

REGINA.

PRINTED BY R. B. GORDON, PRINTER TO THE GOVERNMENT OF THE NORTH-WEST TERRITORIES.

1890.
To His Honor the Lieutenant-Governor of the North-West Territories,

May it Please Your Honor,

I have the honor to submit the Public Accounts of the North-West Territories for the Financial Year ended 30th June, 1890.

I have the honor to be,

Sir,

Your obedient Servant,

L. O. BOURGET,
Accountant N. W. Government.

Regina, October 29th, 1890.

AUDITOR'S REPORT.

ACCOUNTANT'S OFFICE,
NORTH-WEST GOVERNMENT,
REGINA, 31ST OCTOBER, 1890.

His Honor the Lieutenant-Governor,
North-West Territories, Regina.

Sir,—In accordance with Your Honor's Instructions, I beg to report that I have periodically examined the books and accounts of the North-West Government for the year ending 30th June, 1890, and have found the same correct.

The usual tabular form is appended to the accounts of Receipts and Expenditures of the Local Revenue Fund, showing balance from last year to be $8,370.12; Receipts, $19,559.11; and Expenditure, $16,461.16; leaving a balance in hand of $11,468.07.

The amount refunded by Schools is $10.60, leaving a balance due of $55.25.

I have the honor to be,

Sir,

Your obedient Servant,

Hy. LEJEUNE, Auditor.
